title: *Job Fair - Park and Recreation
content:
Job Posting Closing on: Saturday, December 2, 2023
Find your next job! Reserve your spot and submit your resume now!
If you are wanting to have fun & make an impact in the Fort Worth Community, then join us at the Park & Recreation Department! The Park & Recreation Department maintains more than 200 parks and public spaces citywide as well as providing recreational activities and educational programming that makes Fort Worth a great place to live, work and play.
Hiring Event
Date: Saturday, December 2nd  
Time: 10 AM – 2 PM
Location: La Gran Plaza
4200 South Freeway, Fort Worth, TX 76110
(by the flagpoles)
On the spot interviews!!!
Maintenance Worker - Minimum Qualifications: 

High school diploma/GED and no experience required
Valid Driver’s License
Must pass Pre-Employment Drug Screen, Physical and Criminal Background check.

Sr. Maintenance Worker - Minimum Qualifications:

High School Diploma/GED
Three (3) years of general maintenance, park maintenance, and /or construction experience
Valid Class C Driver's License
Must pass Pre-Employment Drug Screen, Physical and Criminal Background check.

Recreation Division
Recreation Assistant - Minimum Qualifications:

Must be age 16 or older and no experience required.
Must pass tuberculosis screening

Community Center Aide - Minimum Qualifications:

High School Diploma or GED
At least six months of experience in recreation or athletic services and programs
Valid driver’s license
Possess, or have the ability to obtain a CPR, First Aid, and AED certification during the first six months of employment
Must pass Drug Screen, Physical, Tuberculosis screening.

 
Walk-ins will be accepted on the day of the job fair, please be sure to bring your Resume.Conditions of Employment
The City of Fort Worth is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.  It is the policy and practice of the City to recruit, hire, train and promote a diverse workforce without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, parental status, military service, or another non-merit factor.
The City of Fort Worth is committed to full compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to participate in the job application or interview process and to perform essential job functions.
Candidates who do not meet the Education requirement, may be considered if they have more relevant work experience than the position requires. Those selected for employment will be required to pass Pre-Employment checks depending on the position requirements. Those could include, but are not limited to: criminal background check, drug screen, education verification, etc. criminal convictions will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Employees are paid by direct deposit only.
